newsitem.title: FINLAND: Huhtamaki proposes key staff option scheme.
newsitem.headline: Huhtamaki proposes key staff option scheme.

text.p: Finnish confectionery and packaging group Huhtamaki Oy said on Monday it would launch a 450,000 markka stock incentive scheme for its key managers.

"The executive board of Huhtamaki ... is seeking approval from the company's annual general meeting, convening on April 9, for a stock incentive plan concerning some 90 group executives and managers," Huhtamaki said in a statement.
Huhtamaki said the proposed scheme would entitle to the subscription of a maximum of 450,000 new Huhtamaki series I shares during the years 2000-2004.

"The subscription price would be the share's weighted average price on the Helsinki Stock Exchange on April 10 to 16, 1997 plus 20 markka, minus any dividend paid on the share for 1997 and the following years until subscription," it said.
